#summary Tutorial of the ros lisp node

*Note: If hiro_ros_bridge is running, (see Startup Tutorial) this node connects to the topics published by it, other wise it starts its own simulation*

  * Start Node and load hiro script
{{{
  $ roscd hironx_ros_bridge/scripts
  $ rosrun roseus roseus
  $ load "kawada-hironx-example.l"
}}}
  * Starting commands for some movements
{{{
  $ rosrun roseus roseus
  #load objects
  $ objects (list *hiro*)
  # send new elbow angle to visualization in lisp
  $ send *hiro* :arms :elbow-p :joint-angle -120
  # get real robot joint angles
  $ send *ri* :state :potentio-vector
  # send lisp position vector to real robot (3000 ms to reach the point)
  $ send *ri* :angle-vector (send *hiro* :angle-vector) 3000  
}}}
  * Draw a cube 
{{{
  # make a cube in lisp visualization
  $ setq a (make-cube 100 100 100)
  # visualize the cube in the visualiztion  
  $ objects (list *hiro* a)
  # send location for the cube 
  $ send a :locate #f(200 200 200)
  # do invers kinematics with target
}}}
